sub_title: TEFL Teacher at Jackie The English Tutor
summary:
After working in online higher education providing support and guidance to Masters and Doctoral students, I have taken a new career direction.  I now have a GA Level 5 Diploma in Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL), awarded by i-to-i the world-leading course provider, and have completed specialisms in Teaching English One-to-One and Online and also Teaching Business English.

The TEFL qualification comprises:

•	English Language Teaching and learning in Context
•	Lesson Planning and Resources in English Language Teaching & Learning
•	Teaching English Language – Vocabulary, Grammar and Pronunciation
•	Teaching the Four Skills – Speaking, Listening, Reading and Writing

I have solid experience of working with part-time adult student professionals from all parts of the world and provided help and guidance at all stages of their studies.  The study language was English which was often an additional challenge for some students in the course of their studies.  I am now sharing my excellent English teaching, writing and communication skills to help students of different Nationalities improve their English.  Some of my students are adult professionals who are taking one-to-one lessons to refine their English skills.  These are customized lessons to prepare them for further success in their business.

education.field_of_study: Teaching English as a Second or Foreign Language/ESL Language Instructor

certifications.name: Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL)
certifications.license_number: Gatehouse Awards LEVEL 5 Diploma in Teaching English as a Foreign Language

profile_positions.description:
I have worked for many years in online higher education, providing non-academic guidance and support to international Master and Doctoral students located all around the world as they worked online to complete their degrees.

It was hugely satisfying to see them achieve success which then helped them to further their careers and life opportunities.

Many of the students did not have English as their first language and so they faced additional challenges studying in English and specifically academic English.

This background combined with my love of the English language and English literature meant that it was a logical next step for me to become more involved in the actual teaching of English as a second language.

I am now working with a number of students, both online and face-to-face, to help them improve their standard of English.  I create customised lesson plans exactly tailored to my students' interests and motivations for speaking and writing in English.   I use actuality and original materials to provide entertaining and challenging opportunities for my students to learn and progress in each lesson.  My aim is always to encourage students to expand their knowledge and capabilities so that they feel they have made progress after each lesson and look forward to the next one.
profile_positions.title: TEFL Teacher

profile_positions.description: AdamHelpt connects with Amsterdam businesses and companies who want to make  a social contribution to help individuals and under-resourced organisations throughout the Amsterdam  area.   As a volunteer with AdamHelpt  I helped  with  the coordination and planning of specific projects.   This involved supervision and guidance of company volunteers and overseeing the planned activities.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer project co-ordinator

profile_positions.description: Supervision and guidance to Upper School students with homework and projects and additional English language support on an ad hoc basis.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer with Study Circle for International School Hilversum

profile_positions.description:
I improved communication and collaboration between working communities at the University of Liverpool Online operation and Laureate Online Education.   I created and delivered presentations to external faculty, to introduce the online study culture and to  ensure the highest success rates for new faculty applicants.   I administrated preparation of student applications for academic references on behalf of the University of Liverpool by developing key procedures.  I formulated, edited, proofread and published online faculty newsletter. 

Key contributions included:

* Championed a launch of communication tool to develop sense of cohesion among faculty and stakeholders across disciplines and Laureate departments.
* Rolled-out innovative procedure to vet and filter applications for online doctorate faculty positions (module tutors and thesis supervisors DBA and EdD).
* Introduced contemporary and stylish new Faculty Handbook in very fast turnaround time to communicate current processes and procedures.
*  Credited for designing and creating web-based newsletter format for international distribution and which met with CEO approval.
profile_positions.title: Senior Communications and Faculty Support Specialist, Learning Communities

profile_positions.description:
I assisted students pursuing online Masters study programmes awarded by the University of Liverpool while heading international team of student support managers.  I enhanced student progression and retention by determining optimum balance between best interests of students and business interests of company.  I liaised with University of Liverpool faculty.  I evaluated team individuals' performance on a regular basis and administered annual review and renewal of team member contracts.  I performed management strategy review and oversaw planning of study programme curriculum.

A few key contributions included:

* Motivated and guided team members in resolving challenging  online student issues by drawing upon own personal experiences as effective student support manager.
* Designed outreach initiatives to encourage students on breaks to resume their studies resulting in increased percentage of active students for the whole team.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader, Student Support

profile_positions.description:
I provided empathic guidance and non-academic support to students pursuing online master and doctorate programmes across  several disciplines.  I managed student portfolio of a  maximum of 600 students and worked with them throughout studies towards successful degree completion.  I fostered solid relations with students which included consulting and advising guidance to a Masters graduate to  develop their dissertation topic as a commercial venture.  Supported and mentored students to attain excellent results.

Key achievement included:

*  Built an impressive record of advancement by developing and leading a new mentoring/support process for probationary student support managers.
profile_positions.title: Student Support Manager
